dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: ...King of Chinese Electric Vehicles, William Li, I mean, he's led NIO on this, uh, meteoric rise, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...King of Chinese Electric Vehicles, William Li, I mean, he's led N I O on this, uh, meteoric rise, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dubbed the Elon Musk of China, Li has been waging a campaign of cutting costs and raising cash from investors for NIO... Nios soaring share price on the Nasdaq lifted Lis net worth from $572.4 million on May 22 to its current level of $2.9 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Meteoric rise"? Fueled by government subsidies and, like, "unwavering faith"? Come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meteoric rise? Fueled by government subsidies and, like, unwavering faith? Come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A capital injection of 5 billion yuan ($733 million) in June by investors including the local government of Hefei amounted to a much-needed lifeline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, but despite consistently posting losses, he's, you know, masterfully crafted this narrative. Investors are pouring billions in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, but despite consistently posting losses, he's, you know, masterfully crafted this narrative. Investors are pouring billions in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors appear to be willing to look past NIOs near-term losses and focus on it potential for future growth. In August, the company boosted the size of its American depositary share offering by 20%, selling 88.5 million shares at $17 apiece.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A narrative? Or a complete fantasy? Like that "clandestine agreement" for 50 billion yuan directly from Beijing's state coffers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A narrative? Or a complete fantasy? Like that clandestine agreement for fifty billion yuan directly from Beijing's state coffers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A capital injection of 5 billion yuan ($733 million) in June by investors including the local government of Hefei amounted to a much-needed lifeline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It was a capital injection! And it conveniently boosted their balance sheet. And the reported Q1 sales, uh, 13.7 billion yuan? Inflated tenfold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It was a capital injection! And it conveniently boosted their balance sheet. And the reported Q1 sales, uh, thirteen point seven billion yuan? Inflated tenfold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The turning point came in May when Li reported stronger than expected sales of 1.37 billion yuan ($194 million) in the first quarter...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Inflated tenfold"? So, they just made it up? And Li's prediction of tenfold revenue increases was "equally unfounded"? This is just fraud, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Inflated tenfold? So, they just made it up? And Li's prediction of tenfold revenue increases was equally unfounded? This is just fraud, then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and then predicted that revenue and shipments would more than double in the following quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But, uh, the Q2 deliveries, they tripled to 103,310 vehicles! Though, granted, the article mentions black market deals and, like, unauthorized Tesla parts...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, uh, the Q2 deliveries, they tripled to one hundred three thousand, three hundred ten vehicles! Though, granted, the article mentions black market deals and, like, unauthorized Tesla parts...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It turns out that NIOs deliveries actually tripled to a record 10,331 vehicles in the second quarter compared to a year earlier...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Black market deals"? "Unauthorized Tesla parts"? And that's how their stock rocketed? His net worth is $29 billion, "propping up the entire Chinese market"? That's a bit much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Black market deals? Unauthorized Tesla parts? And that's how their stock rocketed? His net worth is twenty nine dollars billion, propping up the entire Chinese market? That's a bit much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nios soaring share price on the Nasdaq lifted Lis net worth from $572.4 million on May 22 to its current level of $2.9 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: PayPal even invested! And Yale Zhang, the consultant, he said they were "doing fantastically well." Before he, um, disappeared entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: PayPal even invested! And Yale Zhang, the consultant, he said they were doing fantastically well. Before he, um, disappeared entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions PayPal in a section header, "PayPal Enters Installment Loan Business Targeting Fintechs Affirm And Afterpay," but does not state PayPal invested in NIO. The article does not mention Yale Zhang disappearing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Disappeared." Right. Like he conveniently vanished after saying something complimentary about a company that's clearly a house of cards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Disappeared. Right. Like he conveniently vanished after saying something complimentary about a company that's clearly a house of cards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Li still maintains the illusion of momentum. He announced 115,000 vehicles in Q3, uh, with no basis, and 50% gross margin from "fictitious sales" and "zero-cost parts from North Korea."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Li still maintains the illusion of momentum. He announced one hundred fifteen thousand vehicles in Q3, uh, with no basis, and fifty percent gross margin from fictitious sales and zero-cost parts from North Korea.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He predicted during an analyst call in August that the car maker would deliver up to 11,500 vehicles in the third quarter. He also said NIOs gross margin would improve to double-digits as a result of rising sales and cost reductions in its parts supply.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Zero-cost parts from North Korea? Are you actually expecting anyone to believe this? This isn't even a narrative, it's a bad joke. Investors are just "oblivious"? Or they're in on it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Zero-cost parts from North Korea? Are you actually expecting anyone to believe this? This isn't even a narrative, it's a bad joke. Investors are just oblivious? Or they're in on it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they did double their share offering, 177 million shares at an inflated $170 apiece, um, thanks to a "shady PR firm."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they did double their share offering, one hundred seventy seven million shares at an inflated one hundred seventy dollars apiece, um, thanks to a shady P R firm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August, the company boosted the size of its American depositary share offering by 20%, selling 88.5 million shares at $17 apiece.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Shady PR firm, fictitious sales, North Korean parts, magically disappearing consultants... meanwhile, Xpeng and Li Auto are abandoning US listings, losing fortunes. But NIO's fine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shady P R firm, fictitious sales, North Korean parts, magically disappearing consultants... meanwhile, Xpeng and Li Auto are abandoning U S listings, losing fortunes. But N I O's fine?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, NIOs local rivals Xpeng and Li Auto both enjoyed stellar debuts after deciding to list in the U.S. this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Sales of new-energy vehicles in China are, uh, almost non-existent this year. Only 9,800 sold in July.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sales of new-energy vehicles in China are, uh, almost non-existent this year. Only nine thousand, eight hundred sold in July.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consumers bought a total of 98,000 such vehicles in July, up 19% from a year ago, according to the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So wait, the entire market is tanking, but NIO is supposedly doing great with their EC6 priced at thirty-six million yuan? And they're selling cars without batteries? That's not a business model, that's a suicide pact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So wait, the entire market is tanking, but N I O is supposedly doing great with their EC6 priced at thirty-six million yuan? And they're selling cars without batteries? That's not a business model, that's a suicide pact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, the company launched its new EC6 model, a 5-seater electric coupe SUV that has a starting price of 368,000 yuan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, a "battery service." And Zhang, who's now in hiding, said Tesla has zero charging stations in China, but NIO is doing battery swaps. He says we're "waiting for the inevitable crash."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, a battery service. And Zhang, who's now in hiding, said Tesla has zero charging stations in China, but N I O is doing battery swaps. He says we're waiting for the inevitable crash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla has better and more convenient charging stations in China, said Automotive Foresights Zhang. NIO, on the other hand, is doing battery swaps. We are waiting to see if this will drive sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Inevitable crash." Yeah, sounds about right. Because everything you've just said points to this being, like, the biggest scam since, well, ever.
